content.description: Short crack behind tree. There are some holds on the face to the left but try and stay in the crack. Kind of challenging in an awkward kind of way.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice crash space with minor tree hazard.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk up the hill on the right hand trail to the top and clearing. Turn right(west) and walk past the boulder on your left with the big scoop(

Cheech and Chong

)to the rock with left arching seam right next to a tree. This is

Yellowbeard

. On the otherside of the tree is a tall arete. This is

Greybeard

. To the right of the arete is a knobby low angle face. This is

Blackbeard

. These routes are always in the shade. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Easy and well featured face, crux at the top. Lots of start and finish options.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space.
content.location:
From the parking area walk up the hill on the right hand trail to the top/clearing.

Bumfight

is the arete on tall boulder on your right(west). Its the tallest boulder up there, you cant miss it.

Wheelchair

is on the south(uphill) face.

Beggar

is the northeast arete and

Open Sewer

is on the northern(downhill) side. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Crux is at the top, but there's a deep dish on top.
content.protection: Pad
content.location: Left of "Dance to It". But right if the arete.

content.description: Arete. Holds get better as you ascend
content.protection:
Pad

(a bit hard to protect because there's a sappy tree trunk right at the corner of the arete
content.location:
Arete right of uncle Ho

Obvious, sappy tree trunk at base and some knobby easy holds on the face to the right

content.description: Can be done SDS or standing, on great begining holds, up and over a small lip or straight up the high but featured face.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat with just enough space to drop without hazard.
content.location:
From the parking area,follow the right hand trail up the hill to the top/clearing. On the western edge of the clearing, is a boulder with a big scoop, just right of a tree. This is

Cheech

. Left of the tree is

Chong

. Behind this boulder is

Up In Smoke

, the tall, knobby slab. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Easy but dirty arete. Could clean real nice if it saw more traffic. Eliminates abound.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat with plenty of room.
content.location: From the parking area, walk up the hill on the right hand trail to the top/clearing. Unnamed is the first climbable rock on your left about halfway up the trail. The route faces downhill. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Sit start on sidepulls, move up to a deep mail slot and some nubbins and move up to a good left hand.
content.protection: Crash pad
content.location: To the immediate right of The Choadler and to the left of the cave route Keys to the Kingdom.

content.description: Start with left hand on small sidepull crimp and make some long moves to a huge patina jug.
content.protection: Pad
content.location: On the boulder inbetween Leahs Traverse and Painted Carnival

content.description: High crack on big boulder. Jugs at the top. Try an stay in the crack.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot.
content.location: Picnic Area, follow right hand trail from parking area up the hill just past Juan Carlo Dyno boulder. The crack is obvious, facing down hill.

content.description: Sit start on some really small crimps, square up and throw for a great left hand sidepull. Pull over the top on big knobs
content.protection: Pad
content.location: Before you get to Painted Carnival take a left towards the picnic boulder and look to your right.

content.description: Start the crack to the right of Juan Carlo Dyno and climb to good pockets up high. Kind of slopey on the top.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat with plenty of space.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk up the hill on the right hand trail, which runs right into the Sunkissed boulder. From left to right, if your facing up hill are Mammoth of Wrath, Juan Carlo Dyno and the crack is called Sunkissed. Lelah's Traverse starts in the crack ans ends near Juan Carlo. Around the corner to the right of the arete is Reese's Route. Crack of Nonsense is the dominant feature on the boulders west face. The face to the right of the crack is called Red Sea.

There is a fun un-named route left of the tree that gos V0, V1 SDS.

Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Low start the crack, moving up and right.
content.protection: crash pad, spot
content.location: Uphill and to the right of Orange, Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: From the short slab, climb the left had side of the face on knobs and pockets to some slopy features up high, easy top out.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space. Mind the slab you started on.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk straight up the hill on the left hand trail to the top/clearing. On the southeastern edge of the clearing is a small cluster of boulders all off by themselves, the tallest of which has a tree growing right next to it. Left of the tree is

Refund

. Right of the tree is

Subtle Suggestion

.

Revolution

and

Aristocratic Action

are on the boulders north face.

Excessive Pope

is on the short boulder just north of the large one. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: SDS left of tree on overhung but grippy holds to jugs up high to easy top out. I think you need to keep close to the tree on smaller holds if you want to keep it V1.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space. Mild tree hazard.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk straight up the hill on the left hand trail to the top/clearing. On the southeastern edge of the clearing is a small cluster of boulders all off by themselves, the tallest of which has a tree growing right next to it. Left of the tree is

Refund

. Right of the tree is

Subtle Suggestion

.

Revolution

and

Aristocratic Action

are on the boulders north face.

Excessive Pope

is on the short boulder just north of the large one. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Start on some rare Pine mountain pockets and move to the lip
content.protection: Crash pad

content.description: Very easy prow once you work out the start.
content.protection: crash pad, spot
content.location: Right behind Orange, Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: SDS right of the tree, over the bulge to low angle face.
content.protection: crash pad, spot
content.location:
From the parking area, walk straight up the hill on the left hand trail to the top/clearing. On the southeastern edge of the clearing is a small cluster of boulders all off by themselves, the tallest of which has a tree growing right next to it. Left of the tree is

Refund

. Right of the tree is

Subtle Suggestion

.

Revolution

and

Aristocratic Action

are on the boulders north face.

Excessive Pope

is on the short boulder just north of the large one. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Fun, easy face with knobs and plates. Can be done SDS from the right or traversed onto from the left. Whatever, have fun with it.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space.
content.location:
From parking area, walk straight up the hill on the left hand trail to the top/clearing. Turn right and your looking at

Pilgrim

, a steep but knobby and narrow face climb. Walk up to it and the short/steep wall to the left is called

Consumer Gluttony

. To the right of

Pilgrim

, down in a corner/roof/ledge kind of thing is

Bronze Age

. These routes are in the shade most of the day. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description:
Start as for No Picnic and dyno to the jug and up. More of an eliminate for people tall enough to use the gaston.

instagram.com/p/By_vQD3Do6E/
content.protection: Maybe a pad.
content.location: The No Picnic boulder

content.description: Climb the left arete
content.protection: Pad
content.location: On the left side of the Picnic boulder

content.description: Start low, move to hidden knob out right
content.protection: Pad
content.location: Right of "Painted Carnival" around corner next to tree

content.description: Start in the cave, come out to the lip and grab the pinch on the roof. Get a hand out over the lip and the brace yourself for a commiting, yet not diffucult mantle.
content.protection: Crash Pad
content.location: Go up the ridge and head west until you see a cave made up of two touching boulders.

content.description: Start matched on the one pad undercling on the gently overhanging face, move up and right to the arête. Swim up the arête until you can gain a micro-crimp with the left hand then make a dynamic move further left to a sloping dish on the lip. Top out up and left.
content.protection: Pads
content.location: The start is about 3 feet to the left of Blunted.

content.description: SDS with a undercling/lever kind of move and then fire quickly for the knobs. Easy top out.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat with plenty of place.
content.location: From the parking area, follow the left hand trail toward the top of the hill. About 3/4 of the way up Orange and Ritualistic Hibernation will be on your right. Both problems face downhill.

content.description: Start at the center of the Picnic Boulder. Grab some egdes, long move right, then left to finish.
content.protection: Crash pad
content.location: The first boulder on your way up to the ridge.

content.description:
Sit start on left good hold and right sharp undercling, then bust a big move to the sharp crimp and top out as Morally Impaired. Nothing fancy, just simple fantastic movement. Pure crimp power.

Is the far-most right rail on? Your call. Certainly makes it harder without.
content.location: Left of Morally Impaired.

Shares starting ledge with the "Juan Carlo Dyno" and a pocket

Located to the left of "Juan Carlo Dyno" (Obviously) which itself is to the left of "Sunkissed"

content.description: Make moves up gritty crimps up a dark face of perfect rock
content.protection: Crash Pad, rock and tree stump under the fall zone

climbs.name: Look Mom, I Lost Another Tooth

content.description: Facing downhill, start at the bottom right of the boulder, work your way up and left to the top. Alternately, you can start low on the left and go straight up. Check out the downhill side for more one/two move nonsense.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk up the hill on the right hand trail to the top/clearing. Just as you enter the clearing on your left is a short 7 footer. This is

Look Mom

. Its located between

Consumer Gluttony

and

Juan Carlo Dyno

boulders. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description:
Start in the cave, on two underclings. Bust straight out the overhanging bulge using upside heel toe cams and compression trickery!

Low to the ground, and some dab potential on the adjacent rock, but good fun regardless. Unique movement for Pine.
content.protection: You can do it without a pad... But one is nice.
content.location: In the Picnic area, find The Choadler. When facing The Choadler, head right and go through the cave. Starts in the gross underbelly!

content.description: Match hands then shoot straight up for the knob. Careful, its sharp up there.  Be prepared to invest some skin till you get it wired. Not really a true dyno for the tall folk, more like a big dynamic lunge.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, just mind the rock and tree.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk up the hill on the right hand trail, which runs right into the

Sunkissed

boulder. From left to right, if your facing up hill are

Mammoth of Wrath

,

Juan Carlo Dyno

and the crack is called

Sunkissed

.

Lelah's Traverse

starts in the crack ans ends near

Juan Carlo

. Around the corner to the right of the arete is

Reese's Route

.

Crack of Nonsense

is the dominant feature on the boulders west face. The face to the right of the crack is called

Red Sea

.

There is a fun un-named route left of the tree that gos V0, V1 SDS.

Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Climb the arete using holds on the right side. Solid footwork will get you to a flake up high and out left, then reach up for the low profile knobs on top, get your feet up and pull over.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. This route has a hugh crash space, go for it.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk up the hill on the right hand trail to the top and clearing. Turn right(west) and walk past the boulder on your left with the big scoop(

Cheech and Chong

)to the rock with left arching seam right next to a tree. This is

Yellowbeard

. On the otherside of the tree is a tall arete. This is

Greybeard

. To the right of the arete is a knobby low angle face. This is

Blackbeard

. These routes are always in the shade.

content.description: Start with left hand on under cling side-pull and a crimp for the right. Throw to a right sloper/pocket and head straight up. A low variation exists.
content.protection: A pad
content.location: If you are standing and the base of No Picnic turn 180 degrees and it’s the Boulder next to the tree with the cave-like belly and a large undercling rail

content.description: Short easy problem. Work the edge on the western end or fire straight up the center of the north face knobs and pockets and stuff. Can be done SDS. Try it with no hands.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk straight up the hill on the left hand trail to the top/clearing. On the southeastern edge of the clearing is a small cluster of boulders all off by themselves, the tallest of which has a tree growing right next to it. Left of the tree is

Refund

. Right of the tree is

Subtle Suggestion

.

Revolution

and

Aristocratic Action

are on the boulders north face.

Excessive Pope

is on the short boulder just north of the large one. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Uses the same starting holds as No Picnic, but stays to the right side of the boulder, all the way through the finish. A victory jug for the last move makes the problem that much more fun.
content.protection: Landing is slightly sloping, but clean. Maybe a pad.
content.location: On the picnic boulder. One of the first boulders you'll come across on the way up from the campground. The problem is on the west-facing wall.

content.description: High face on bulge. Crux at the bottom
content.protection: pad
content.location: Left of "Terraced Garden"

content.description: Crack/groove to jugs
content.protection: Pad
content.location: The Groove diametrically opposite of "Sunkissed"

content.description: Short easy wall featured with little knobs and edges with big holds up top. Nice rock and cool looking too. Can be done as a contrived SDS if your tips are up for it.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space.
content.location:
From parking area, walk straight up the hill on the left hand trail to the top/clearing. Turn right and your looking at

Pilgrim

, a steep but knobby and narrow face climb. Walk up to it and the short/steep wall to the left is called

Consumer Gluttony

. To the right of

Pilgrim

, down in a corner/roof/ledge kind of thing is

Bronze Age

. These routes are in the shade most of the day. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Left of tree, nice arete on good holds and knobs. Top out by stepping high or half mantle to the right.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space. Mild tree hazard, mind the limbs.
content.location:
From the parking area,follow the right hand trail up the hill to the top/clearing. On the western edge of the clearing, is a boulder with a big scoop, just right of a tree. This is

Cheech

. Left of the tree is

Chong

. Behind this boulder is

Up In Smoke

, the tall, knobby slab. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Sit start on some big holds, make some moves to a good sidepull and up to a right hand "buttcrack" hold and then up to a left sloping dish up high. Super fun
content.protection: Crash pad

content.description: Right of the tree, scooped face to huge bucket. Can be done as a dyno to bucket, fun. Another variation follows the knobs to the left of the scoop.
content.protection: crash pad, spot
content.location:
From the parking area,follow the right hand trail up the hill to the top/clearing. On the western edge of the clearing, is a boulder with a big scoop, just right of a tree. This is

Cheech

. Left of the tree is

Chong

. Behind this boulder is

Up In Smoke

, the tall, knobby slab. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Nice and tall arete with great holds. Gets steep up high but not to worry, jugs and plates near the top. Very fun. Can be done SDS but its much more fun to traverse on from the left or right.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space.
content.location:
From the parking area walk up the hill on the right hand trail to the top/clearing.

Bumfight

is the arete on tall boulder on your right(west). Its the tallest boulder up there, you cant miss it.

Wheelchair

is on the south(uphill) face.

Beggar

is the northeast arete and

Open Sewer

is on the northern(downhill) side. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Sit start using the ledge, fire up left then right. Step high and climb over the top on weird knobs.
content.protection: crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space.
content.location:
From parking area, walk straight up the hill on the left hand trail to the top/clearing. Turn right and your looking at

Pilgrim

, a steep but knobby and narrow face climb. Walk up to it and the short/steep wall to the left is called

Consumer Gluttony

. To the right of

Pilgrim

, down in a corner/roof/ledge kind of thing is

Bronze Age

. These routes are in the shade most of the day. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: From hollow crimp, head up and right
content.protection: pad
content.location: Right of "Blemish of the Soul"

content.description: Sit start left hand on a crimp right hand on a hold shaped like a peanut. Make some moves to a dish and another crimp, hand/foot match, rock over and mantle it out. Incredibly pleasing.
content.protection: No pad required.
content.location: On the left side/corner of the Painted Carnival boulder

content.description:
OK, time to play.

Blemish

starts with a no hands, one move step-up to a steep face and then a long reach for the jug up top. Pull over the top with the jug and odd knob. Silly I know, now try and top out with only one hand...

If you are vertically challenged(like the yougsters in the photo to the right), this route can be done using the various pockets and seams on the rock's face to get your feet high enough so you can reach the big jug. Shorter folk may find themselves with a tough half mantle for the top out. Dont worry, its a great landing with and easy spot, go for it.
content.protection:
Crash pad, spot. This route shares crash space with routes on

Bumfight's

south face.
content.location:
This boulder is right next to the

Bumfight

boulder(which is the tallest boulder on top of the hill) and the route is on the boulder's northern side. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description:
Climb knobs and grippy holds on low angle face, right of the arete. Can be done SDS or start as

Greybeard

.
content.protection:
Crash pad, spot. At such a low angle its hard to fall off this route. But if you did, you migh be in trouble. So, its a tricky proposition on where to place your pad; cover the rock at the base or pad the ground at the very bottom or both. Just make sure you spotter is protecting the rocks at the base.

Or better yet, just dont fall.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk up the hill on the right hand trail to the top and clearing. Turn right(west) and walk past the boulder on your left with the big scoop(

Cheech and Chong

)to the rock with left arching seam right next to a tree. This is

Yellowbeard

. On the otherside of the tree is a tall arete. This is

Greybeard

. To the right of the arete is a knobby low angle face. This is

Blackbeard

. These routes are always in the shade.

content.description: Easy arete, but tall
content.protection: Pad
content.location: Right of "Bumfight"

content.description: Start from the ground on right side of the north face with some tricky footwork. Keep your balance and climb on good holds to an undercut. Clamp on to it, get your feet high and step over the top.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat, plenty of space.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk straight up the hill on the left hand trail to the top/clearing. On the southeastern edge of the clearing is a small cluster of boulders all off by themselves, the tallest of which has a tree growing right next to it. Left of the tree is

Refund

. Right of the tree is

Subtle Suggestion

.

Revolution

and

Aristocratic Action

are on the boulders north face.

Excessive Pope

is on the short boulder just north of the large one. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Backside of easy face on knobs.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. Nice and flat with plenty of room.
content.location: From the parking area, walk up the hill on the right hand trail to the top/clearing. Antiques is on the south face of boulder at the end of the trail. Picnic Area, Pine Mtn.

content.description: Easy wall using the arete with pockets and knobs out to the left, easy top out with your choice of jugs and edges. Really fun and can be done SDS or traversed on to from the left.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. The crash space slopes away from the boulder and there are a couple of rocks near the base but its easily protected with a pad and good spot.
content.location:
Picnic Area, behind and slightly down hill of the

Cheech and Chong

boulder.
